docs.text:
Welcome to CS61 SI!


This is where all of the labs will be posted.


What is SI?


Supplemental Instruction is a series of weekly review sessions for students taking historically difficult courses.
It offers students the chance to collaborate, discuss challenging concepts, and study for exams.


What isn’t SI?


Supplemental Instruction is not a lecture.
SI Leaders are not there to teach you new material but to lead you in reviewing the material covered in lecture and to help guide you in understanding the subject.


Who should go?


If you are in a Learning Community, attendance is mandatory.


Guidelines:




Be respectful. This includes silencing your cell phones and not using them during sessions.


Participate! You won’t get very much out of SI if you don’t.


No food or drink besides water. This is a rule placed by the administration. I will enforce it.


Late entry and early exit should be quiet.


Sign in, even if you are late.

docs.title: Guidelines:

docs.text:
Questions






ISA stands for ________.

What is an ISA? What information is included in an ISA?






What is a microprocessor?






What do you think microprocessors are made of?






How do you think a microprocessor is designed?






What is the relationship between a microprocessor and assembly language?






What are you expecting to learn from this class?






The three types of instructions in LC-3 are ________, ________, and ________.






In the LC-3, there are 8 ________________ that serve as on-chip memory.






The BR (branch) instruction reads from the ________ to find out if the ________ was Negative, Zero, or Positive.






In the line of code 
BRnz LABEL
, when would the branch be taken?






Can the LC-3 do everything the new Intel Pentium microprocessor can do?






Name 3 operation instructions.






Name 2 data movement instructions.






Name 3 or 4 control instructions.






What information is specified in the 
ADD
 and 
AND
 instruction?






Problems






What is 
2
 in binary? 
4
? 
13
? 
27
?






What is 
1001 0110 + 0011 1101
? 
0111 1111 + 0001 1100
?






What is 
-4
 represented in 8-bit twos complement? 
-7
? 
-18
? 
-31
?






Can -200 be represented in 8-bit twos complement?






What is 
0101 1001 - 0011 0111
? 
0011 1100 - 0101 1010
?
